meanings.definition: An extremely wicked or cruel act, typically involving physical violence or injury.
meanings.sent1: The atrocity committed by the villain shocked everyone in the town.
meanings.sent2: The news of the atrocity spread quickly, causing fear among the people.
meanings.sent3: Despite being a comedy show, the play humorously portrayed an atrocity scene.
meanings.sent4: The atrocity of the crime left a scar on the community that would never fade.
meanings.sent5: The vivid description of the atrocity haunted the witness for years to come.

meanings.definition: A highly unpleasant or distasteful situation or event.
meanings.sent1: The long wait at the airport was an atrocity for the tired passengers.
meanings.sent2: The atrocity of the rainy weather ruined the outdoor picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: Finding a spider in her soup was an unexpected atrocity during dinner.
meanings.sent4: The atrocity of losing her favorite book made her feel devastated.
meanings.sent5: The atrocity of the traffic jam made him late for the important meeting.
